item.title: Quick & Cozy Vegetable Soup in 30 Minutes
item.description: Cozy up with this vegetable soup that's ready in just 30 minutes! Packed with vibrant veggies and rich flavors, it's perfect for those chilly nights. Ideal for family gatherings or meal prep. Save this recipe for later, you won't regret it!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 10 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 20 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 tablespoon olive oil
  • 1 medium onion, chopped
  • 2 cloves garlic, minced
  • 2 carrots, diced
  • 2 stalks celery, diced
  • 1 bell pepper, chopped
  • 1 zucchini, diced
  • 1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes, with juice
  • 4 cups vegetable broth
  • 1 teaspoon dried oregano
  • 1 teaspoon thyme
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh parsley for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. First, heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Toss in the chopped onion and sautÃ© for about 3 minutes until it softens.
  2. Next, add the minced garlic, carrots, and celery. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally until everything is fragrant and slightly tender.
  3. Then, stir in the bell pepper, zucchini, and canned tomatoes. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring the mixture to a boil.
  4. Once boiling, reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, until the veggies are soft but still vibrant.
  5. Add the oregano, thyme, salt, and pepper. Give it a good stir and let it simmer for another couple of minutes.
  6. Finally, ladle the soup into bowls and garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

item.title: Creamy Green Bean Casserole That Everyone Will Love!
item.description: Creamy green bean casserole, a classic dish that brings warmth to any gathering! Loaded with fresh green beans, a rich sauce, and crispy onions on top. Great for family dinners or holiday feasts. Save this for your next celebration!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 6

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 pound fresh green beans, trimmed and cut into 1-inch pieces
  • 1 can (10.5 oz) cream of mushroom soup (I use Campbell's)
  • 1/2 cup milk (any kind works, I like whole milk)
  • 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese (I always use Tillamook)
  • 1 cup crispy fried onions (like French's)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Preheat your oven to 350Â°F (175Â°C). Get that warmth going while you prep!
  2. In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook the green beans for about 5 minutes until they're bright green but still crisp. Drain and set aside.
  3. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the cream of mushroom soup and milk until smooth. Add in the cheddar cheese and stir until blended. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  4. Combine the cooked green beans with the soup mixture in a large casserole dish. Mix until the beans are well coated.
  5. Top the casserole with crispy fried onions. You can either sprinkle them on lightly or pile them high (I usually go for high!).
  6. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the edges are bubbly and the top is golden brown. Let it cool for a few minutes before serving.
